DataElement.preferredName: Single Nucleotide Polymorphism Probe Annotation Single Nucleotide Polymorphism Database Version java.lang.Integer
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A variation of a single nucleotide at a specific location of the genome due to base substitution, present at an appreciable frequency between individuals of a single interbreeding population.:General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.:An explanatory or critical comment that has been added to a text._The Single Nucleotide Polymorphism database (dbSNP) is a database repository and internet resource for a broad collection of simple genetic polymorphisms. It is hosted by the National Center for Biotechnology Information:A form or variant of a type or original._Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is an Integer (32-bit two's complement).

As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.:An explanatory or critical comment that has been added to a text._The Single Nucleotide Polymorphism database (dbSNP) is a database repository and internet resource for a broad collection of simple genetic polymorphisms. ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A variation of a single nucleotide at a specific location of the genome due to base substitution, present at an appreciable frequency between individuals of a single interbreeding population.:General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. Concepts.definition: A variation of a single nucleotide at a specific location of the genome due to base substitution, present at an appreciable frequency between individuals of a single interbreeding population.

General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.
An explanatory or critical comment, or other in-context information (e.g., pattern, motif, link), that has been associated with data or other types of information.

Property.preferredDefinition: The Single Nucleotide Polymorphism database (dbSNP) is a database repository and internet resource for a broad collection of simple genetic polymorphisms. It is hosted by the National Center for Biotechnology Information:A form or variant of a type or original.

Concepts.definition: A database repository and internet resource for a broad collection of simple genetic polymorphisms.  It is hosted by the National Center for Biotechnology Information.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/2/11 - Released as part of caArray v2.4 model cleanup.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is an Integer (32-bit two's complement).

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
